com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.mode.face

Class FaceAuthService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.mode.face.FaceAuthService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthService

    public class FaceAuthService
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuthService
    An interface that represents Facial authentication service. This is an entry point to Facial library.
    Since:
    4.2

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static FaceAuthService create(AuthenticationModule module)
        Create face authentication service which is the entry point of face authentication feature.
        Parameters:
        module -
        Returns:
        faceAuthService

      • setContext

        @Deprecated
public static void setContext(android.content.Context context)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated starting from 4.5. This method is now empty (do nothing) It is not necessary to call this function since the context can use ApplicationContext, which has been provided through ApplicationContextHolder

      • initialize

        public void initialize(FaceAuthInitializeCallback callback)
        Initialize the biometric face engine. This operation must be done before any other face operations. This is an asynchronous method that will takes times in seconds. Upon completion of the initialization, the callback will be invoked. Please take note that context must be set previously by calling setContext(Context).
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to be invoked upon completion of this operation

      • configureLicense

        public void configureLicense(FaceAuthLicense faceAuthLicense,
                             FaceAuthLicenseConfigurationCallback faceAuthLicenseConfigurationCallback)
        Configure license. This API is always required for license retrieval when the license is expired. It will check if there is existing license and the validity before sending HTTP request to request the license. If the existing license is still valid, there is no HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        faceAuthLicense - the FaceAuthLicense
        faceAuthLicenseConfigurationCallback - callback to be invoked upon completion of this operation
        Throws:
        IdpAuthException

      • isLicenseConfigured

        @Deprecated
public boolean isLicenseConfigured()
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated! Indicates if the license has been configured. It is deprecated since SDK must be able to re-request the license automatically when it is expired. SDK do not store entitlementId value on persistent storage, hence @{link configureLicense(FaceAuthLicense, FaceAuthLicenseConfigurationCallback) is always required to be called
        Returns:
        false always

      • uninitialize

        public void uninitialize()
        Uninitialize the biometric face engine. Face operations will no longer work before initialize is called again.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Indicates if the library has been initialized.
        Returns:
        true if it has been initialized

      • getFaceAuthFactory

        public FaceAuthFactory getFaceAuthFactory()
        Get FaceAuthFactory for Face object creation
        Returns:
        Factory instance

      • getAuthMode

        public FaceAuthMode getAuthMode()
        Get authentication mode reference corresponding to this service.
        Specified by:
        getAuthMode in interface AuthService
        Returns:
        current auth mode.

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported()
        Indicates if the authentication mode is supported by the hardware and OS. This should be always checked before using Face Authentication functionalities. Skipping this check is not encouraged and it may crash your application when executing on a device which is below Android 4.4.
        Specified by:
        isSupported in interface AuthService
        Returns:
        true if supported, else return false.

      • isConfigured

        public boolean isConfigured()
        Indicates if the authentication mode is configured and ready for use. For example, a face template needs to be enrolled before this authentication mode can be used.
        Specified by:
        isConfigured in interface AuthService
        Returns:
        true if configured, else return false.

      • reset

        public boolean reset()
              throws IdpException
        Cleanup the data associated with FaceID. The license file will be preserved. Re-enrolment of face template is required.
        Returns:
        true if rest is successful.
        Throws:
        IdpException - failure during cleanup. Refer to error code and error message for the details.
        Since:
        4.9.0
        See Also:
        IdpCore.reset()

      • isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ

        public boolean isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ()
                                     throws IdpException
        Check if the migration is needed for Android Q. If the migration is needed, app should ask the end user for the permission READ_PHONE_STATE and then call the migration API migrateForAndroidQ().

        NOTE: This API should be called during the application startup to make sure that the permission popup, if any, will not interfere with other business flow.

        For more information on Android Q privacy changes, refer to https://developer.android.com/preview/privacy/data-identifiers#device-ids

        Returns:
        true if migration is needed.
        Throws:
        IdpException - When database operation failed.
        Since:
        4.9.2
        See Also:
        migrateForAndroidQ()

      • migrateForAndroidQ

        public void migrateForAndroidQ()
                        throws IdpException
        Migrate the old data to be compatible with Android Q. In order to retrieve the old data, this API needs the READ_PHONE_STATE permission to be granted. After the migration, the permission is not required anymore.

        For more information on Android Q privacy changes, refer to https://developer.android.com/preview/privacy/data-identifiers#device-ids

        Throws:
        IdpException - When database operation failed.
        Since:
        4.9.2
        See Also:
        isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ()
